1.display: An improved tool for gathering grass and flowers. It's been modified to make gathering easier, and reaps everything as quietly and lightly as the wind.
1.name: Silent Sickle

2.display: An improved tool for splitting firewood and cutting down trees for lumber. It's been modified for better balance and sharpness, making gathering easier than ever.
2.name: Golden Axe

3.display: A stronger version of the Bomb Rod. The jewel at the tip is blue now, and it can destroy rocks and crystals more easily.
3.name: Blue Bomb Rod

4.display: An improved Fishing Rod. Fish will no longer flee from it, and some will even be more attracted to it than usual.
4.name: Divine Fishing Rod

5.display: A mechanical arm made by the Sirens. It has a crushing grip strength and an extremely powerful mining laser. It might be useful for gathering alchemy materials.
5.name: Laser Cutter

10.display: An Augment Module for Reisalin Stout. A constantly glowing staff. It continues to give off a bright, dazzling light even if you don't do anything. It's said that its light makes the hearts of everyone it shines on brighter.
10.name: Sparkling Reverie

20.display: An Augment Module for Klaudia Valentz. This bow is named for the way the arrows it releases shine like stars in the dark. It must be awful seeing someone aim this at you in the darkness...
20.name: Astrumnox

30.display: An Augment Module for Patricia Abelheim. A sentient sword that chooses its own wielder. If a warrior doesn't have a proud soul, they'll never be able to use it no matter how skilled they might be.
30.name: Edel Schwert

40.display: An Augment Module for Lila Decyrus. A legendary weapon once wielded by warriors of the Oren race. It's said that simply equipping it grants you the strength of nature spirits in your surroundings.
40.name: Oren Herald

50.display: An Augment Module for Serri Glaus. This band was once worn by someone known as the Flower Sage. Apparently, this person was always surrounded by flowers, and flowers will bloom wherever the wearer walks.
50.name: Grand Floracion

60.display: An Augment Module for Kala Ideas. A war hammer with an unusual shape. The opposite side of the flat part is just stylish.
60.name: Elder Lily

70.display: An incredibly powerful explosive with fire affinity. Deals damage to the enemy.
70.name: Grand Bomb

80.display: An incredibly powerful explosive with ice affinity. Deals damage to the enemy.
80.name: Crystal Ice Bomb

90.display: An incredibly powerful explosive with lightning affinity. Deals damage to the enemy.
90.name: Laute Plajig

100.display: An incredibly powerful explosive with wind affinity. Deals damage to the enemy.
100.name: Wirbel Luft

110.display: A hammer that has the power to shake the earth with a single powerful strike. It got its name due to the fact that when the earth shakes and the air trembles, it reminds people of the creation of the world.
110.name: Genesis Hammer

120.display: A bullet that does not require a gun barrel. When you release it toward the target, it will fly around in the sky and then go in a straight line to the target, exploding on impact.
120.name: Bubble Bullet

130.display: An incredibly powerful explosive. Can lower the enemy's defense.
130.name: N/A

140.display: An incredibly powerful item. Can lower the enemy's stats, but using it consumes HP.
140.name: Apocalypse

150.display: A thin cloth with a mystical pattern. Spread it over yourself to protect against all kinds of attacks.
150.name: Mystic Robe

160.display: A powerful medicine said to heal all illness and injuries, and even revive the dead. It's one of alchemy's greatest creations, and only a handful of alchemists are skilled enough to make it.
160.name: Elixir

170.display: A harmonica that will convey your feelings and thoughts through its sound. It provides various enhancements both to the one who plays it and to those who hear it.
170.name: Energianica

180.display: Contains a random Alchemist's Workshop-themed gear skin.
180.name: Random Gear Skin Box (Atelier Ryza)

190.display: An item resembling a keycard, made from combining the other four keys. It should slot into the device by the barrier's door at the Central Foundation.
190.name: Central Foundation Key

200.display:
A sculpture made from materials gathered among the ruins, commemorating the glorious adventure you've had. Obtained from the collab event The Alchemist and the Archipelago of Secrets.
 "...Yup, this is also a barrel! "
200.name: Ruins Explorer Sculpture

210.display: A small bottle containing elemental power. It has an affinity with all elements, which is useful but also makes it difficult to work with.
210.name: Spirit Bottle

220.display: A common alchemic compound. A red liquid with fire affinity.
220.name: Red Neutralizer

230.display: A common alchemic compound. A blue liquid with ice affinity.
230.name: Blue Neutralizer

240.display: A common alchemic compound. A yellow liquid with lightning affinity.
240.name: Yellow Neutralizer

250.display: A common alchemic compound. A green liquid with wind affinity.
250.name: Green Neutralizer

260.display: An advanced material created from the four Elemental Cores. Since it has high affinity with all elements, it's extremely useful in alchemy.
260.name: Crystal Element

270.display: Can be added to the Core Nexus in The Alchemist and the Archipelago of Secrets, granting the following effect in corresponding event stages: increases the FP, AVI, and TRP of your ships.
270.name: Offense Boost Core

280.display: Can be added to the Core Nexus in The Alchemist and the Archipelago of Secrets, granting the following effect in corresponding event stages: reduces the DMG taken by your ships.
280.name: Defense Boost Core

290.display: Can be added to the Core Nexus in The Alchemist and the Archipelago of Secrets, granting the following effect in corresponding event stages: in combat, your ships slowly restore HP over time.
290.name: Regeneration Core

300.display: Can be added to the Core Nexus in The Alchemist and the Archipelago of Secrets, granting the following effect in corresponding event stages: once per battle, when one of your ship's HP falls beneath 20.0%, she will regain a portion of her HP.
300.name: Damage Control Core

310.display: Can be added to the Core Nexus in The Alchemist and the Archipelago of Secrets, granting the following effect in corresponding event stages: your fleets will receive supporting barrages during combat that Burn enemies hit.
310.name: Covering Fire Core

320.display: Can be added to the Core Nexus in The Alchemist and the Archipelago of Secrets, granting the following effect in corresponding event stages: your fleets will receive supporting barrages during combat that will temporarily increase the DMG taken by enemies hit.
320.name: Anti-Armor Volley Core

330.display: Can be added to the Core Nexus in The Alchemist and the Archipelago of Secrets, granting the following effect in corresponding event stages: your fleets will receive additional EXP from sorties.
330.name: Experience Boost Core

340.display: Can be added to the Core Nexus in The Alchemist and the Archipelago of Secrets, granting the following effect in corresponding event stages: your fleets will gain additional Affinity from sorties.
340.name: Affinity Boost Core

350.display: Resource used to craft, upgrade and convert Augment Modules.
350.name: Augment Module Stone T2
